content.description: Start on 2 pinches underneath the overhang. Reach out and pull on to the face to start working your way left and as low as possible.. staying off the jug rails overhead. Cross, pinch, and crimp your way to the top of the ledge to finish.
content.location: Low right start of many faces

content.description: Start with jugs on the face. Climb diagonally up and left through a small split to reach the ledge finish.
content.protection: Multiple pads would be nice as the landing is rocky
content.location: Overhanging boulder start of Many Faces
Easy, take it to the heels of the Giant, moving gracefully onto his back, reaching for the crown. Anything is good

content.description:
Start under jawline about a foot and half from Arete, moving up along prominent nose line, over cheekbone to the corner of eye/headdress, to top! 

 Slipping feet, easily recoverable. A couple holds are kind of long and reachy.
content.location: First route about a foot and a half in to the right of the Arete.  In the Many Faces Area

content.description: Sit for a bouldery start below the overhang. Pull out and up onto the face - this is the crux. Continue up good pinches and crimps staying to the right of the diagonal "zag" until you top out though the obvious V at the top of the rock.
content.protection: Two mid-sized trees at the top can be used for anchor building. Static rope or long slings / cord is useful here.
content.location: This face is viewed from the lowest access trail and North of The Island by couple hundred feet or so.
Under the handsome neck, prominent jawline and chin of man, creep past his downturned lip, past the high cheekbone to the temple and behind his revered Frog Hat!
Obvious boulder start, cause a burger hits you like one, creeping the edge, all condiments are on, till you reach the height of the grilled stack yo!

content.description: Beta - At Project Start: Right toe hook just above overhang and right side crimp above toe hook in pitting. Smear left (foot) to reach left for small upper cling. Move to set feet on smedging above right toe hook(just above overhang).  Good match climbing through middle up to ledge at Aztec head. The crux of the problem is transitioning from the middle route to Aztecs head crack.  Striations around head are mostly slopers.  Fun climb!
content.location: Start at the mans feet, walking back and forth up the midline to and over his square face to top

content.description: Beautiful Two-Faced, multifaceted rock climbing experience, shrouded in myster, covered by the Emerald canopy...  Preceeded by Mini Island (bouldering just N), Phantom Area and Boulder Traverse
